properties.name: Blome Road Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Peggybloomer Blome Road Cincinnati, Ohio-One lane bridge built in 1888 -recieved a plaque for being a historical landmark in 1991 by the Indian Hill Historical Society

properties.name: First Home
properties.description: Posted by Peggybloomer longren ct

properties.name: General August Willich Home
properties.description: Posted by Peggybloomer 1419 Main Street Cincinnati Ohio-August Willich (1810-1878) - Left Germany after German revolution to New York, then moved to Cincinnati. -Editor of German Newspaper -Joined Union Army during Civil War -lived here from 1867-1870

properties.name: Second Home-Blue Ash Ohio
properties.description: Posted by Peggybloomer Fawnrun Drive-Rural community of farms during 1800\'s, a village in 1955, and as a city in 1961

properties.name: The Elliott House
properties.description: Posted by Peggybloomer 9352 Given Rd., Remington Ohio-Oldest remaining house built in Indian Hill

properties.name: The Village of Indian Hill
properties.description: Posted by Peggybloomer 6525 Drake Rd CIncinnati Ohio-Settled in 1795 -Indian tribes such as Shawnee, Miami, and Delaware came to this area to hunt and fish -1787, Major Benjamin Stites, a veteran of the Revolutionary War, found Indian Hill; also purchased Mariemont.

properties.name: Third Home-Mariemont Ohio
properties.description: Posted by Peggybloomer Ashley Meadow Ct-1786-1925: the Stites and Ferris families -Major Benjamin Stites bought land here -sold Mariemont to the Ferris brothers

properties.name: Washington Park
properties.description: Posted by Peggybloomer 1230 Elm St, Cincinnati, OH-Opened in 1861 -social, cultural, political activities -Friedrich Hecker (1811-1881) a German revolutionary who came to the U.S. after the German revolution failed in 1848. -Robert L. McCook also has a bust of himself in Washington Park

properties.name: Ziegler Park
properties.description: Posted by Peggybloomer -Ziegler Park was named after David Ziegler (1748-1811) by the Over-the-Rhine Germans. He fought in the Revolutionary War and was the first mayor of Cincinnati in 1802.
